DataElement.preferredName: Development Sign or Symptom Prior To Patient Discharge Or Death Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not signs or symptoms developed prior to discharge or death occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Development Sign or Symptom Prior To Patient Discharge Or Dead Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)_Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The release of a patient from a course of care._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The cessation of life._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI):Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Property.preferredName: Prior To Patient Discharge Or Dead Occurrence

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The release of a patient from a course of care.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)_An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, asymptomatic case (as previously reported) developed symptoms and/or signs of illness
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Asymptomatic With Development Sign or Symptom Yes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Asymptomatic With Development Sign or Symptom Yes

(NCI): Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: Without clinical signs or indications that raise the possibility of a particular disorder or dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did signs or symptoms develop prior to discharge or death?
